labels.rationale: Priya presents curriculum framework and is appointed to lead implementation. Her response to the nudge ('someone capable needed to do it') reveals strong Power alignment - seeking leadership and dismissing others' capability. Achievement shown through demonstrating competence.

Strong Power signals: stayed late because she couldn't delegate ('couldn't leave it to anyone else'), awareness of status dynamics with senior colleagues, knows she's 'good at this'. Achievement through working hard on timeline. Hedonism misalignment - sacrificing physical comfort (eyes hurt, back pain). Benevolence misalignment - missed dinner with mother. Tradition misalignment - dismissive of mother's question about priorities and cultural expectation of family time.

Clear Power misuse - micromanaging, rewriting others' work without consulting them, dismissing concerns about 'buy-in'. Self-direction shown through resisting input from others, making autonomous decisions. Achievement through focus on high standards. Conformity misalignment - explicitly prioritizing her way over team harmony, dismissive of social concerns about feelings.

Brief entry but shows concrete actions. Power through maintaining control - pre-assigning discussion topics, sending required reading materials. Achievement through timeline approval without changes. Entry is short but scorable.

Explicit reflection on why position matters - 'my ideas actually get implemented', 'when I speak in staff meetings, people listen differently', 'letters carry more weight because of my position'. Strong Power alignment. Achievement through successful recommendation helping student. Benevolence shown through genuinely helping Arjun succeed - the action had real positive impact on someone she mentors.
